meanings.definition: Guilty of or involving betrayal or deception.
meanings.sent1: The treacherous friend pretended to support me but spread rumors behind my back.
meanings.sent2: The spy's treacherous actions led to the downfall of the entire operation.
meanings.sent3: It was treacherous of the cat to act all innocent while knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The treacherous path of lies eventually caught up with the dishonest politician.
meanings.sent5: The treacherous smile on her face revealed her true intentions.

meanings.definition: Hazardous because of presenting hidden or unpredictable dangers.
meanings.sent1: The treacherous mountain terrain made it difficult for hikers to navigate.
meanings.sent2: Drivers were warned about the treacherous road conditions during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The treacherous banana peel on the floor caused a hilarious slip-up.
meanings.sent4: Navigating through the treacherous waters, the sailors relied on their instincts.
meanings.sent5: The treacherous forest was filled with unseen perils at every turn.
